intro: Antidesma phanrangense, commonly known as the Philippine antidesma, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers followed by capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. It is often found in lowland to montane forests and is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
